World Cities.meta: Urban agglomerations with a population greater than 100,000.

Seamless towns and suburbs.meta: Seamless boundaries for towns, shopper towns and suburbs in the UK.

work_place_hybrid_zone.name: Workers
work_place_hybrid_zone.meta: 2018 worker counts, densities and occupation splits on hybrid zone level.

infoj.label: Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply
Water supply; Sewerage, waste management and remediation activities
Wholesale and retail trade; Repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles
Public administration and defence; Compulsory social security
Human health and social work activities
Activities of extraterritorial organisations and bodies

education_uni_building.name: University building
education_uni_building.meta: Building for 164 universities in the UK.

education_uni_poi.name: University POI
education_uni_poi.meta: Points of interest at each university including gyms, catering outlets, access points, receptions and porters lodges.

stations.meta: The stations that service underground lines, are part of the National Rail network or the Northern Ireland rail stations and support thirteen light rail systems within the United Kingdom.
stations.name: Rail stations

rail.name: Railways
rail.meta: The rail and light rail systems within the United Kingdom.

roads.name: Road network
roads.meta: The UK’s motorways including all junctions, slip roads, stubs and spurs. All non-primary UK roads (trunk roads or otherwise, A-road). B-roads designated as carrying significant local traffic. Minor roads that are generally local. Minor roads that provide the most satisfactory route for through traffic between places of traffic importance, they are often but not always trunk roads.

retail_pitch.name: Retail Place Pitch
retail_pitch.meta: Comparitive strength within Retail Place area. Hex grid created using Retail Place to determine ranking of each cell within the centre.

Retail pitch rank in decimal scale.label: Retail pitch rank in decimal scale

retail_place_shopcent.name: Retail Place Shopping Centre
retail_place_shopcent.meta: Polygons of all shopping centres within the UK.

rows.fieldfx: SUM(b.pop__17)
rows.title: Current Population

rows.fieldfx: SUM(b.pop__11)
rows.title: Population 2011

rows.fieldfx: SUM(b.pop__17 - b.pop__11) * 100 / SUM(b.pop__11)
rows.title: Population Growth

rows.fieldfx: SUM(eac_student__11) + SUM(ein_student__11)
rows.title: Students

rows.fieldfx: 100*(SUM(pop__11) - SUM(ret_white_tot__11))/SUM(pop__11)
rows.title: % Non-White

rows.fieldfx: 100*SUM(own)/SUM(own+rent+social)
rows.title: Own Home

rows.fieldfx: 100*SUM(rent)/SUM(own+rent+social)
rows.title: Private Rented

rows.fieldfx: 100*SUM(social)/SUM(own+rent+social)
rows.title: Social Rented

rows.fieldfx: 100*SUM(pers1hhd)/SUM(pers1hhd+pers2hhd+pers2plushhd)
rows.title: Single Hhds

rows.fieldfx: 100*SUM(pers2hhd)/SUM(pers1hhd+pers2hhd+pers2plushhd)
rows.title: 2 Person Hhds

rows.fieldfx: 100*SUM(pers2plushhd)/SUM(pers1hhd+pers2hhd+pers2plushhd)
rows.title: 3+ Hhds

rows.fieldfx: SUM(case when ST_distance(ST_Transform(a.geom_4326,27700),ST_transform(b.geom_p_4326,27700))<=250 then b.workers else 0 end)
rows.title: Workers 250m

rows.fieldfx: SUM(case when ST_distance(ST_Transform(a.geom_4326,27700),ST_transform(b.geom_p_4326,27700))<=500 then b.workers else 0 end)
rows.title: Workers 500m

columns.aspatial: age_under_18_uk, age_18to24_uk, age_25to29_uk, age_30to44_uk, age_45to59_uk, age_60plus_uk, age_total_uk FROM mapp.report_summary

round(SUM(pop__11))

Selection Tool.meta:
Click on Editing to reveal the shapes available.

Once you have clicked on the option you want to use, left click anywhere on the map to draw your shape. Move the cursor and click again. For the Polygon tool only, right click to finish drawing.
